results.name: A transform of the Jacobsthal numbers.
comment: Apply the Chebyshev transform (1/(1+x^2), x/(1+x^2)) followed by the binomial involution (1/(1-x),-x/(1-x)) (expressed as Riordan arrays) to -A001045(n). All elements are multiples of a power of 3. - _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 28 2005
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3).
formula: Recurrence: a(n+2) = 3a(n-1) - 3a(n), starting with 0, 1, 1, 1. - _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 28 2005
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[x (1 - x)^2/(1 - 3 x + 3 x^2), {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 13 2014 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( x * (1 - x)^2 / (1 - 3*x + 3*x^2) + x * O(x^n), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 29 2007 */
